post_text: Please watch for our school buses! We are checking each child’s temperature before they board the bus. Help us keep our children safe!
shared_text:
NC Public Schools
August 17 at 1:45 PM ·

The start of the new school year means the big yellow buses are on the road again transporting students safely to and from school. Did you know the most dangerous part of the trip for students is traveling to and from the bus stop and getting on and off the bus? The penalty for passing a stopped bus is a $500 fine and 5 points on your driver’s license? This becomes a felony if you hit a child. Please review the handy refresher on following North Carolina school bus stop laws and remember to give yourself a little extra travel time when you head out in the morning or afternoon.

AMERICAN LEGION DONATES FLAG TO TAYLORSVILLE ELEMENTARY —
The U.S. Flag flown outside Taylorsville Elementary School had become faded and tattered, so American Legion Post 170 of Taylorsville donated a new U.S. Flag to the school on Monday, July 27, 2020. Shown here, left to right: fourth grade teacher (and daughter of U.S. Navy veteran) Michelle Bruder Robinson, principal Janel Lingle, Legion Post 170 Commander Scott Hines, and Post Adjutant Michael Dagenhart. Other local schools with flags in disrepair may contact the American Legion members for a new flag. The group will also ceremonially retire old flags as well. For information, call Scott Hines, 828-632-3152, or Michael Dagenhart, 828-632-2973.

This was shared on someone's personal page - we felt like it was worth sharing with you!
For public school families thinking of homeschooling during COVID, please consider this...

If you want to homeschool your children, please keep them enrolled in public school this fall. Choose the virtual option. You can use the resources that the professionals provide, and you won't have to register as a homeschool. MOST IMPORTANTLY, public schools won't lose funding due to decreased enrollment.

If you choose to withdraw anytime after the 20th day of school, the district maintains its funding, and there is no penalty to you. If you decide to stay once this pandemic is over, your child will get a sound education from highly trained professionals. Its a win for everyone.

If you choose to homeschool and then decide to re-enroll your child after the 20th day, then funding and teacher positions are already cut, and the damage is done.

Please spread the word.

Hey friends in the Bethlehem community! We have a new "Blessing Box" at Bethlehem Elementary. It is basically a small food pantry where people can come get food if they need it - and I'm sure during this time of crisis there are families in our community that do need it. If you have any extra in your pantry, or if you are getting groceries in the next weeks and think about the Blessing Box, please contribute if you feel led!

These are the items most commonly donated and used to stock the Blessing Box:

Canned food with ring-pulls
Crackers
Non-perishable foods
Small snacks
Toiletries, including hand soap, toothbrushes and toothpaste
Baby wipes

Thanks everyone!

Parents, if you are not currently receiving free or reduced meal benefits from school nutrition, but you think you now might qualify because of loss of job or being laid off from work and drawing only unemployment, please complete a meal application immediately because new funds have become available for households of children receiving those meal benefits. These funds are in the form of an EBT card in the amount of $257.00, made in two installments. These funds come directly from DSS, not child nutrition. But DSS will receive the information about meal benefits from the School Nutrition Program, then continue the process. This is a new pandemic-EBT card—and even if you have not previously received an EBT card you will qualify and receive this card by mail. Applications are available on the ACS webpage, or you may pick up an application at the school.
http://www.alexander.k12.nc.us

Hey friends in the Bethlehem community! We have a new "Blessing Box" at Bethlehem Elementary. It is basically a small food pantry where people can come get food if they need it - and I'm sure during this time of crisis there are families in our community that do need it. If you have any extra in your pantry, or if you are getting groceries in the next weeks and think about the Blessing Box, please contribute if you feel led!

These are the items most commonly donated and used to stock the Blessing Box:

Canned food with ring-pulls
Crackers
Non-perishable foods
Small snacks
Toiletries, including hand soap, toothbrushes and toothpaste
Baby wipes

Thanks everyone!

Higher Order Thinking (HOT) alternative to traditional vocabulary multiple choice assessments...
Rock Star, Ashly Huss from WAMS states:
"Normally, I give my quizzes on CANVAS, but I decided to switch it up today. First, students completed vocabulary Frayer Models with words from the stem list as a review. Then, they interacted with the Frayer Models by completing a gallery walk. Their quiz was application; they were expected to use five vocabulary words in a complete sentence. I allowed them to use the Gallery Walk as a resource. The Frayer Models helped to scaffold for struggling learners, but they still had to analyze the clues and decide which vocabulary term was being described. The Frayer Models did not list words, only clues to help them guess words and discover meanings.

The engagement was AMAZING and the quiz was definitely HOT!"
